trans-unit.source: How to Use Docker Quickly with Ubuntu-Docker VM Image
trans-unit.target: How to Use Docker Quickly with Ubuntu-Docker VM Image

trans-unit.source: Describes and demonstrates how to be using Docker on Ubuntu Server in minutes directly from the Azure Image Gallery
trans-unit.target: Describes and demonstrates how to be using Docker on Ubuntu Server in minutes directly from the Azure Image Gallery

trans-unit.source: How to Get Started Quickly with Docker in the Azure Marketplace
trans-unit.target: How to Get Started Quickly with Docker in the Azure Marketplace

trans-unit.source: The fastest way to get started using [Docker] is to go to the Azure Marketplace and create a VM using the Docker on Ubuntu Server image template created by [Canonical] in conjunction with [MSOpenTech].
trans-unit.target: The fastest way to get started using [Docker] is to go to the Azure Marketplace and create a VM using the Docker on Ubuntu Server image template created by [Canonical] in conjunction with [MSOpenTech].

trans-unit.source: This creates an Ubuntu Server VM and automatically installs the Docker VM Extension along with the latest Docker engine pre-installed and running on on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This creates an Ubuntu Server VM and automatically installs the Docker VM Extension along with the latest Docker engine pre-installed and running on on Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can immediately connect to the VM using SSH and begin doing work with Docker directly without doing anything else.
trans-unit.target: You can immediately connect to the VM using SSH and begin doing work with Docker directly without doing anything else.

trans-unit.source: The VM created by the Azure Marketplace template does not host the Docker remote API for management by a remote docker client.
trans-unit.target: The VM created by the Azure Marketplace template does not host the Docker remote API for management by a remote docker client.

trans-unit.source: To enable controlling the Docker Host on this VM remotely, see either <link><linkText>Running Docker with HTTPS</linkText><title></title></link> or follow the steps in <link><linkText>Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To enable controlling the Docker Host on this VM remotely, see either <link><linkText>Running Docker with HTTPS</linkText><title></title></link> or follow the steps in <link><linkText>Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you're feeling especially geeky, you can build the <link><linkText>Windows Docker Client</linkText><title></title></link> from GitHub and try that as well (or just grab it from <link><linkText>nuget</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you're feeling especially geeky, you can build the <link><linkText>Windows Docker Client</linkText><title></title></link> from GitHub and try that as well (or just grab it from <link><linkText>nuget</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: [Log on to the Portal]
trans-unit.target: [Log on to the Portal]

trans-unit.source: [Create a VM with the Docker Image from Canonical and MSOpenTech]
trans-unit.target: [Create a VM with the Docker Image from Canonical and MSOpenTech]

trans-unit.source: [Connect with SSH and Have Fun]
trans-unit.target: [Connect with SSH and Have Fun]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Log on to the Portal<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Log on to the Portal<html></html>

trans-unit.source: This part is easy, unless you don't have an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: This part is easy, unless you don't have an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Get a free one easily, too</linkText><title></title></link>!
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Get a free one easily, too</linkText><title></title></link>!

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Create a VM with the Docker Image from Canonical and MSOpenTech<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Create a VM with the Docker Image from Canonical and MSOpenTech<html></html>

trans-unit.source: Now that you're logged on, click New in the lower left-hand corner to create a new VM image.
trans-unit.target: Now that you're logged on, click New in the lower left-hand corner to create a new VM image.

trans-unit.source: You might see the proper image in the banner immediately:
trans-unit.target: You might see the proper image in the banner immediately:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose the Docker Ubuntu image in the banner</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose the Docker Ubuntu image in the banner</linkText>

trans-unit.source: But if not, search for it in the Image Gallery:
trans-unit.target: But if not, search for it in the Image Gallery:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Locate the image in the Image Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Locate the image in the Image Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Provide either the username and password for the instance, or a .pem file to enable SSH using a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Provide either the username and password for the instance, or a .pem file to enable SSH using a certificate.

trans-unit.source: (The below graphic shows specifying a username and password combination.)
trans-unit.target: (The below graphic shows specifying a username and password combination.)

trans-unit.source: Then press Create at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: Then press Create at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure the vm instance</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure the vm instance</linkText>

trans-unit.source: And wait until it's running.
trans-unit.target: And wait until it's running.

trans-unit.source: It shouldn't take too long at all.
trans-unit.target: It shouldn't take too long at all.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Docker image running in portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Docker image running in portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Connect with SSH and Have Fun<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Connect with SSH and Have Fun<html></html>

trans-unit.source: Now the fun starts.
trans-unit.target: Now the fun starts.

trans-unit.source: You can immediately connect to the VM using SSH:
trans-unit.target: You can immediately connect to the VM using SSH:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connecting with SSH</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connecting with SSH</linkText>

trans-unit.source: and start issuing Docker commands, remembering that on this Azure VM the default configuration requires **sudo**:
trans-unit.target: and start issuing Docker commands, remembering that on this Azure VM the default configuration requires **sudo**:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Pulling images</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Pulling images</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You're going to want to start using [Docker]!
trans-unit.target: You're going to want to start using [Docker]!
